Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d‚ÄôYquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot‚ÄîBotrytis Cinerea‚Äîdevelops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we‚Äôre hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Roman√©e-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our √† la carte menu from 18th July.

Posts.title: Invitation to an exceptional gastronomic journey where tactility becomes a language.
Posts.content:
On November 13th and 14th, @lemeuricealainducasse restaurant will host a unique four-hand dinner, conceived by the Dom P√©rignon Society chefs, @amaurybouhours and @qiqedacosta , alongside Maison @domperignonofficial .
Following an initial encounter in Spain, a unique sensory experience will come to life, highlighting the dialogue between haute French and Spanish cuisine around tactility, inspired by Dom P√©rignon vintages.
A celebration of excellence and creativity. ‚ú®

Enjoy responsibly

Posts.title: Farewell Dinner
Posts.content:
Entertaining my Iceland guests their farewell dinner with us before their departure to the island of Langkawi on monday morning.
Semlm mereka went to Central market and China town for shopping while i had my facial appointment in the morning then 3pm attending my company board meeting.
We talked about many issues as well as planing for our new overseas expansion as well which my chairman would like to have in Singapore, Dubai, London, New York to Sydney and even Melbourne.
So he has asked both Andre and me to look also for any other investors yang berminat to colloborate with us di masa akan datang.
China is also another huge potential market he told us to explore.
Our Chairman ni muda dan sangat bercita cita tinggi.
Naik bulu roma saya mendengar permintaan ini semua.
Bukan senang to realise all this dream.
Kena berani.....cari investors tak ada masalah.
Once u have satu successful module the rest will just follow mudah sahaja.
We shall see...
He said i want to target our revenue will go up to at least rm200 juta sebukan CW!
I almost fall off the chair semlm hearing his wishes.üòúü§¶
Berani ke ambil cabaran itu.
Anyway i have my signature home big sale demo today with Diana Danielle juga dia Ambassador.
With this event maka end la contract saya tahun ini as their kitchen Ambassador.
Alhamdulilah semua berjalan dgn baik dan sempurna.
Once the event end at 5pm i will need to rush home quickly and have my shower and head to KLIA for my 10.25pm flight to Tokyo on Japan Airline.
I really wanted to fly with MAS tapi the last business class ticket was taken by Dato Noraini and Dr Fadzil my last gang to Japan.
Since we are all suppose to meet together in Tokyo airport, collect our Shinkanzen 2 weeks train ticket before heading to Nagoya straight terpaksa la kami ambil JAL instead.
Nasib ada business class ticket depa lagi.
We both arrive pun different 1 jam sahaja.
So will wait for them.
Mean while my friend Wan Latifah dan suami left semlm.
Depa tidur di airport hotel saja then kita berenam semua akan bercuti bersama.
Gang2 gila travel ini semua i have known for 35 years.
Semua dah tua2 serabut but we always have so much fun laughing together in so many of our trip.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we‚Äôre busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that‚Äôs going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you‚Äôre a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is ‚Äúlargest gathering of Uncle Rogers‚Äù. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We‚Äôre all really proud of the food we‚Äôre putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger‚Äôs fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I‚Äôm also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you‚Äôre in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we‚Äôll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Post.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Post.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we‚Äôre busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that‚Äôs going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you‚Äôre a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is ‚Äúlargest gathering of Uncle Rogers‚Äù. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We‚Äôre all really proud of the food we‚Äôre putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger‚Äôs fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I‚Äôm also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you‚Äôre in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we‚Äôll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Post.title: Farewell Dinner
Post.content:
Entertaining my Iceland guests their farewell dinner with us before their departure to the island of Langkawi on monday morning.
Semlm mereka went to Central market and China town for shopping while i had my facial appointment in the morning then 3pm attending my company board meeting.
We talked about many issues as well as planing for our new overseas expansion as well which my chairman would like to have in Singapore, Dubai, London, New York to Sydney and even Melbourne.
So he has asked both Andre and me to look also for any other investors yang berminat to colloborate with us di masa akan datang.
China is also another huge potential market he told us to explore.
Our Chairman ni muda dan sangat bercita cita tinggi.
Naik bulu roma saya mendengar permintaan ini semua.
Bukan senang to realise all this dream.
Kena berani.....cari investors tak ada masalah.
Once u have satu successful module the rest will just follow mudah sahaja.
We shall see...
He said i want to target our revenue will go up to at least rm200 juta sebukan CW!
I almost fall off the chair semlm hearing his wishes.üòúü§¶
Berani ke ambil cabaran itu.
Anyway i have my signature home big sale demo today with Diana Danielle juga dia Ambassador.
With this event maka end la contract saya tahun ini as their kitchen Ambassador.
Alhamdulilah semua berjalan dgn baik dan sempurna.
Once the event end at 5pm i will need to rush home quickly and have my shower and head to KLIA for my 10.25pm flight to Tokyo on Japan Airline.
I really wanted to fly with MAS tapi the last business class ticket was taken by Dato Noraini and Dr Fadzil my last gang to Japan.
Since we are all suppose to meet together in Tokyo airport, collect our Shinkanzen 2 weeks train ticket before heading to Nagoya straight terpaksa la kami ambil JAL instead.
Nasib ada business class ticket depa lagi.
We both arrive pun different 1 jam sahaja.
So will wait for them.
Mean while my friend Wan Latifah dan suami left semlm.
Depa tidur di airport hotel saja then kita berenam semua akan bercuti bersama.
Gang2 gila travel ini semua i have known for 35 years.
Semua dah tua2 serabut but we always have so much fun laughing together in so many of our trip.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d‚ÄôYquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot‚ÄîBotrytis Cinerea‚Äîdevelops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we‚Äôre hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Roman√©e-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our √† la carte menu from 18th July.

Post.title: Farewell Dinner
Post.content:
Entertaining my Iceland guests their farewell dinner with us before their departure to the island of Langkawi on monday morning.
Semlm mereka went to Central market and China town for shopping while i had my facial appointment in the morning then 3pm attending my company board meeting.
We talked about many issues as well as planing for our new overseas expansion as well which my chairman would like to have in Singapore, Dubai, London, New York to Sydney and even Melbourne.
So he has asked both Andre and me to look also for any other investors yang berminat to colloborate with us di masa akan datang.
China is also another huge potential market he told us to explore.
Our Chairman ni muda dan sangat bercita cita tinggi.
Naik bulu roma saya mendengar permintaan ini semua.
Bukan senang to realise all this dream.
Kena berani.....cari investors tak ada masalah.
Once u have satu successful module the rest will just follow mudah sahaja.
We shall see...
He said i want to target our revenue will go up to at least rm200 juta sebukan CW!
I almost fall off the chair semlm hearing his wishes.üòúü§¶
Berani ke ambil cabaran itu.
Anyway i have my signature home big sale demo today with Diana Danielle juga dia Ambassador.
With this event maka end la contract saya tahun ini as their kitchen Ambassador.
Alhamdulilah semua berjalan dgn baik dan sempurna.
Once the event end at 5pm i will need to rush home quickly and have my shower and head to KLIA for my 10.25pm flight to Tokyo on Japan Airline.
I really wanted to fly with MAS tapi the last business class ticket was taken by Dato Noraini and Dr Fadzil my last gang to Japan.
Since we are all suppose to meet together in Tokyo airport, collect our Shinkanzen 2 weeks train ticket before heading to Nagoya straight terpaksa la kami ambil JAL instead.
Nasib ada business class ticket depa lagi.
We both arrive pun different 1 jam sahaja.
So will wait for them.
Mean while my friend Wan Latifah dan suami left semlm.
Depa tidur di airport hotel saja then kita berenam semua akan bercuti bersama.
Gang2 gila travel ini semua i have known for 35 years.
Semua dah tua2 serabut but we always have so much fun laughing together in so many of our trip.

Recipes.ingredients: Beef,Olive oil,mushrooms,thyme,puff pastry,ham,egg yolks,water,Sea salt,black pepper
Recipes.steps:
Wrap each piece of beef tightly in a triple layer of cling film to set its shape, then chill overnight.
Remove the cling film, then quickly sear the beef fillets in a hot pan with a little olive oil for 30-60 seconds until browned all over and rare in the middle. Remove from the pan and leave to cool.
Finely chop the mushrooms and fry in a hot pan with a little olive oil, the thyme leaves and some seasoning. When the mushrooms begin to release their juices, continue to cook over a high heat for about 10 minutes until all the excess moisture has evaporated and you are left with a mushroom paste (known as a duxelle). Remove the duxelle from the pan and leave to cool.
Cut the pastry in half, place on a lightly floured surface and roll each piece into a rectangle large enough to envelop one of the beef fillets. Chill in the refrigerator.
Lay a large sheet of cling film on a work surface and place 4 slices of Parma ham in the middle, overlapping them slightly, to create a square. Spread half the duxelle evenly over the ham.
Season the beef fillets, then place them on top of the mushroom-covered ham. Using the cling film, roll the Parma ham over the beef, then roll and tie the cling film to get a nice, evenly thick log. Repeat this step with the other beef fillet, then chill for at least 30 minutes.
Brush the pastry with the egg wash. Remove the cling film from the beef, then wrap the pastry around each ham-wrapped fillet. Trim the pastry and brush all over with the egg wash. Cover with cling film and chill for at least 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the red wine sauce. Heat the oil in a large pan, then fry the beef trimmings for a few minutes until browned on all sides. Stir in the shallots with the peppercorns, bay and thyme and continue to cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the shallots turn golden brown.
Pour in the vinegar and let it bubble for a few minutes until almost dry. Now add the wine and boil until almost completely reduced. Add the stock and bring to the boil again. Lower the heat and simmer gently for 1 hour, removing any scum from the surface of the sauce, until you have the desired consistency. Strain the liquid through a fine sieve lined with muslin. Check for seasoning and set aside.
When you are ready to cook the beef wellingtons, score the pastry lightly and brush with the egg wash again, then bake at 200¬∞C/Gas 6 for 15-20 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and cooked. Rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Meanwhile, reheat the sauce. Serve the beef wellingtons sliced, with the sauce as an accompaniment.

Posts.title: My First Restaurant in Malaysia !
Posts.content:
aking a short break from youtube weejios this month because we‚Äôre busy opening a restaurant in my hometown of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia! FUIYOH!

Never in my life would I expect this to be a reality. 4 years ago I was just a comedian making silly videos in my apartment. And now I have a fried rice restaurant that‚Äôs going to get roasted by everyone HAIYAAA.

Grand opening is on September 11, put in your calendars so you never forget. But if you‚Äôre a fan who wants to make history with Uncle Roger and me, come dressed as Uncle Roger on September 14, 9am. Uncle Roger will be filming and attempting a few Guinness World Records, one of which is ‚Äúlargest gathering of Uncle Rogers‚Äù. For more details check @fuiyohitsuncleroger profile link.

This is your chance to be in an Uncle Roger long form weejio on the main channel. Uncle Roger will of course be there as well and he can do photos with as many nieces and nephews as time permits.

The team and I have been eating so much fried rice wok hei is now my favorite cologne. We‚Äôre all really proud of the food we‚Äôre putting out.

But seriously, a sincere thank you to all the love and support all you nieces and nephews have shown me since the beginning. I hope to one day expand the restaurant internationally so everyone can try Uncle Roger‚Äôs fried rice.

PS: Right after the restaurant opens, I‚Äôm also off to do shows in Delhi, Taipei and Dubai. Still some tickets available if you‚Äôre in those cities - another reason why September will be light on videos. But we‚Äôll be back soon I promise! Link In bio for tickets.

Recipes.ingredients: onions,lat-leaf parsley,olive oil,fennel seeds,dried chilli flakes,chopped tomatoes,lemon,sardines,extra virgin olive oil,dried spaghetti
Recipes.steps:
In a microwave-safe heatproof bowl, heat wine until steaming (alternatively, heat wine on the stovetop in a small saucepan). Add raisins and saffron, if using. Set aside.
Collage of raisins soaking in hot wine with saffron. the raisins are plumped and the liquid is golden-yellow.
In a small skillet, heat 1 1/2 tablespoons (22ml) olive oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add ground fennel and cook until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add bread crumbs and cook, tossing, until lightly toasted. Transfer breadcrumbs to a bowl and season well with salt and pepper. Set aside.
A side by side collage of two photos, drizzling olive oil over breadcrumbs and then tossing toasted breadcrumbs in a skillet.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Mince half the fennel fronds and reserve the other half (uncut).
In a large skillet or saut√© pan, heat remaining 3 tablespoons (45ml) olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add diced onion and diced fennel bulb and cook, stirring, until onion and fennel are soft and tender, about 8 minutes. Add anchovy fillets and cook, stirring, until dissolved in the oil.
Collage of anchovies cooking down in pan with chopped fennel.
Add wine, raisins, and saffron, and cook, scraping up any browned bits from bottom of pan, until wine is almost entirely evaporated.
A 4-image collage of pasta con sarde ingredients being added to pan: soaked raisin and saffron, toasted pine nuts, sardine, and then tossing all ingredients to combine.
Add pine nuts and sardines and cook, stirring, until sardines are just barely cooked through, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Meanwhile, cook the pasta until al dente, then drain, reserving at least 1 cup pasta cooking water.
Transfer pasta to skillet along with 1/4 cup pasta cooking water. Return skillet to medium-high heat and cook, stirring and tossing, until pasta is well-coated in sauce and any excess liquid has cooked off. Drizzle on some fresh olive oil (don't be shy) along with the minced fennel fronds, and toss well. Season with salt. Add a very small handful of bread crumbs and toss once more.
If at any point the pasta becomes too dry, add additional pasta cooking water in 1/4-cup increments, and toss to loosen and moisten (you can also drizzle on more olive oil as desired). The noodles should be slick and glossy with a sheen of sauce, but not sitting in a watery puddle.
Divide pasta into serving bowls, making sure to distribute sardines, pine nuts, and raisins evenly. Top with a more generous handful of breadcrumbs. Garnish with whole fennel fronds and serve right away.

Recipes.ingredients: bone-in chicken pieces,water,large carrot,medium tomato,medium onion,crushed black peppercorns,medium potatoes,salt
Recipes.steps:
Gather the ingredients.
Ingredients for Malaysia ABC soup gathered
Put 1 pound bone-in chicken pieces in a medium saucepan with just enough water to cover. Cover and bring to a boil.
Chicken pieces boiling in a pot of water
Drain the water. Rinse the chicken under water to get rid of any impurities.
Boiled chicken rinsed in a colander
Fill a double boiler or a medium soup pot with 4 cups of water. Add the prepared chicken, cover, and boil over medium heat.
Chicken in a pot of water
Once the water boils, remove any impurities from the surface with a ladle. Adjust the heat to low.
Removing impurities with a ladle from the boiling chicken
Add 1 large carrot (peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces), 1 medium tomato (quartered), 1 medium onion (thinly sliced), and 1 teaspoon crushed black peppercorns. Simmer on very low heat for 1 1/2 hours.
Carrots, tomato, onion, and peppers added to the pot with the chicken
Peel 3 medium potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Add to the soup. Continue to simmer until the chicken is cooked and the carrots and potatoes are tender, and still holding their shape, another 2 1/2 hours.
Potatoes in a pot with water, chicken, and vegetables
Add salt, to taste, and serve.

Recipes.ingredients: jasmine rice,coconut milk,pandan leaves,fresh peeled ginger,salt,Sambal,Fried ikan bilis,hard-boiled eggs,Fried peanuts,Sliced cucumbers,banana leaf
Recipes.steps:
Set up a tiered steamer (see notes), filling the bottom section with about 3 inches of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Line the steamer tier with cheesecloth.
Meanwhile, place the rice in a strainer and rinse the grains under running water until the water is almost clear. Drain rice, then transfer to a 10-inch nonstick skillet and add the coconut milk, 7 ounces (200ml) water, pandan leaves, ginger, and salt. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, until it thickens like rice pudding, 8-10 minutes.
Transfer the rice mixture to the cheesecloth-lined steamer tier and spread it in a roughly even layer. Set steamer tier over bottom section of boiling water, cover, and steam over medium heat until the grains are fully cooked, about 45 minutes; start checking rice doneness after 35 minutes of steaming. Once the rice reaches your preferred texture, turn off the heat and leave it to continue steaming, covered, until the steaming stops. The rice should be just cooked, with separate grains and a rich flavor of coconut.
Serve with sambal tumis and other nasi lemak accompaniments, depending on your preference (note that it's typical to leave the pandan leaves in the nasi lemak, as it's understood they will be removed at the table by the diner; do not eat them). If desired, nasi lemak can be served on a banana leaf, which will contribute its own fragrance to the dish as the rice and toppings are eaten.

Recipes.ingredients: All purpose flour,Salt Hot water,Room temperature water,Oil,Butter,Ghee
Recipes.steps:
Divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a smooth dough ball. Pour a little oil into a small bowl, and roll each dough ball in the oil to coat well. Make sure the dough balls aren‚Äôt touching each other if possible, to prevent them from sticking together. It IS okay even if they do stick each other, it‚Äôs just easier to handle if they don‚Äôt.
Place the oil coated dough balls on a plate. You can also add a very thin layer of oil onto the plate. Cover the plate with plastic wrap and let it rest for at least 1 hour. I usually make this about 8 ‚Äì 10 hours ahead of time.
Once rested, place a ball of dough on a clean, smooth, flat surface. Apply a little bit of oil on your working surface. Use your palm to flatten out the dough ball. It should flatten out very easily. Then gently stretch the dough. I prefer to use my hands to do this, but you can also use a rolling pin.
I grab the edge of the dough and gently stretch it out, all the way around. The dough can be stretched out paper-thin without tearing (like with the window pane test). It can be a circle or square in shape.

Recipes.steps:
Soak the rice noodles. Pour boiling water over the rice noodles let them soak until they are soft and pliable (about 5-6 minutes) but not overly soft; drain.
Whisk the Eggs. Whisk the eggs in a medium bowl with a pinch of salt. Set aside by the stove.
How to make Pad Thai Sauce. Whisk the pad thai sauce ingredients together in a small bowl- keeping in mind, there is a delicate balance between salty, sour and sweet, so if you alter one ingredient, you may need to adjust the others. Make sure the sugar completely dissolves.
Prep the Protein & Veggies. Chop the shallot and garlic finely and set aside. Slice chicken thinly across the grain (or peel and devein shrimp). If adding veggies, chop or slice them small, so they cook quickly in the wok.
Prep all your garnishes and have everything ready to go by the stove, keeping in mind the stir fry part will go quickly!
Stir Fry! Season the protein with salt and pepper, and stir fry in a carbon steel wok until just cooked through and set it aside. If adding veggies, stir-fry these now and set aside as well.
Add more oil to the wok and stir fry the garlic and shallots for just a couple minutes, scoot them over, add more oil if needed, and add the whisked the eggs, scrambling and breaking to bits.
Add eggs and scramble
stir fry the rice noodles. Add the noodles and fry
Scoot the eggs over and add more oil and stir fry the noodles, letting the noodles get a little crispy! Turn your hood on and pour in the Pad Thai Sauce. Let the sauce caramelize for 30 seconds, until you smell the sugar caramelizing. This will add great flavor!
Add back in the cooked protein and veggies, with some of the bean sprouts and scallions. Add a squeeze of lime.
Serve. Divide between 2-3 bowls and garnish with fresh bean sprouts, lime, wedge, crushed peanuts, chili flakes, scallions and basil. For extra heat, serve it with our chili garlic sauce!

recipe.ingredients: Beef,Olive oil,mushrooms,thyme,puff pastry,ham,egg yolks,water,Sea salt,black pepper
recipe.steps:
Wrap each piece of beef tightly in a triple layer of cling film to set its shape, then chill overnight.
Remove the cling film, then quickly sear the beef fillets in a hot pan with a little olive oil for 30-60 seconds until browned all over and rare in the middle. Remove from the pan and leave to cool.
Finely chop the mushrooms and fry in a hot pan with a little olive oil, the thyme leaves and some seasoning. When the mushrooms begin to release their juices, continue to cook over a high heat for about 10 minutes until all the excess moisture has evaporated and you are left with a mushroom paste (known as a duxelle). Remove the duxelle from the pan and leave to cool.
Cut the pastry in half, place on a lightly floured surface and roll each piece into a rectangle large enough to envelop one of the beef fillets. Chill in the refrigerator.
Lay a large sheet of cling film on a work surface and place 4 slices of Parma ham in the middle, overlapping them slightly, to create a square. Spread half the duxelle evenly over the ham.
Season the beef fillets, then place them on top of the mushroom-covered ham. Using the cling film, roll the Parma ham over the beef, then roll and tie the cling film to get a nice, evenly thick log. Repeat this step with the other beef fillet, then chill for at least 30 minutes.
Brush the pastry with the egg wash. Remove the cling film from the beef, then wrap the pastry around each ham-wrapped fillet. Trim the pastry and brush all over with the egg wash. Cover with cling film and chill for at least 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, make the red wine sauce. Heat the oil in a large pan, then fry the beef trimmings for a few minutes until browned on all sides. Stir in the shallots with the peppercorns, bay and thyme and continue to cook for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the shallots turn golden brown.
Pour in the vinegar and let it bubble for a few minutes until almost dry. Now add the wine and boil until almost completely reduced. Add the stock and bring to the boil again. Lower the heat and simmer gently for 1 hour, removing any scum from the surface of the sauce, until you have the desired consistency. Strain the liquid through a fine sieve lined with muslin. Check for seasoning and set aside.
When you are ready to cook the beef wellingtons, score the pastry lightly and brush with the egg wash again, then bake at 200¬∞C/Gas 6 for 15-20 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and cooked. Rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Meanwhile, reheat the sauce. Serve the beef wellingtons sliced, with the sauce as an accompaniment.

Chefs.biography: Odette is Royer‚Äôs first venture as Chef-Owner and has since become a prominent dining destination in Singapore. Royer‚Äôs culinary philosophy is deeply influenced by his respect for seasonality, terroir, and artisanal produce, with a cooking style that highlights the natural flavors of ingredients through a delicate, restrained approach. His years of experience in Asia have also influenced his cuisine, adding a sense of place to his dishes.

Nigel NG is the alter-ego of Uncle Roger. He performed the former 'Rice to Meet You' podcast (Now 'HAIYAA with Nigel Ng') and is Uncle Roger's supposed camera person. He runs comedy videos on YouTube and other platforms, and it has become viral. He is a food critic as Uncle Roger and edits the 'weejios.' Uncle Roger is an online personality made up by him and before that, he was a Malaysian stand-up comedian.

Datuk Dr. Redzuawan bin Ismail, universally celebrated as Chef Wan, is Malaysia‚Äôs first celebrity chef and national culinary icon. As Tourism Malaysia‚Äôs food ambassador, Chef Wan has spent more than two decades on the sets of international food television shows. He has cooked for high-profile figures such as the Sultan of Brunei and Bill Clinton.

His cuisine draws deeply from the Mediterranean Sea and the Montg√≥ Natural Park, reflecting the region‚Äôs cultural and natural richness. Known worldwide for his artistic and innovative approach to gastronomy, Dacosta merges tradition with avant-garde techniques, showcasing local ingredients to create dishes that stimulate all the senses. His latest menu, ‚ÄûPor amor al arte II,‚Äù exemplifies his philosophy of combining aesthetics, emotion, and culinary excellence.

To understand Anne-Sophie Pic‚Äôs cuisine, one must understand Anne-Sophie Pic the woman. She is passionate, sensitive, free and determined. Her path exemplifies a unique strength of character, for as a self-taught woman, much conviction, perseverance and faith were asked of her in order to establish herself in a firmly male-dominated universe. She began her journey guided by her palate and sense of smell. When she enters the kitchen, she relies solely on her emotions and intuitions to create her dishes. She learns technique through practice, which affords her the immense freedom to associate tastes, to create her own style, and to seek balance and precision in all things.

From a young age, Yannick All√©no was immersed in the bistro run by his parents, where he spent much of his time. From this bistro, he learned the values of sharing, conviviality, and the counter that invites dialogue.

Trained by some of the greatest Meilleurs Ouvriers de France, such as Gabriel Biscay and Roland Durand, they taught him the discipline and precision of the craft. He then continued his journey at the Louis XIII under the direction of Manuel Martinez, where he honed his techniques and developed a culinary vision focused on excellence, before joining the Drouant alongside Louis Grondard, who deeply influenced him by instilling respect for French gastronomic traditions.

Inspired by Auguste Escoffier, Yannick All√©no doesn't hesitate to revisit the fundamentals and transform this heritage to create his own interpretation. This laid the foundation for a truly distinctive cuisine: Modern Cuisine. He brought sauces back to the forefront, designed using processes like extraction, fermentation, and cryoconcentration, to capture the essence of flavors and allow ingredients to interact.

Posts.title: Farewell Dinner
Posts.content:
Entertaining my Iceland guests their farewell dinner with us before their departure to the island of Langkawi on monday morning.
Semlm mereka went to Central market and China town for shopping while i had my facial appointment in the morning then 3pm attending my company board meeting.
We talked about many issues as well as planing for our new overseas expansion as well which my chairman would like to have in Singapore, Dubai, London, New York to Sydney and even Melbourne.
So he has asked both Andre and me to look also for any other investors yang berminat to colloborate with us di masa akan datang.
China is also another huge potential market he told us to explore.
Our Chairman ni muda dan sangat bercita cita tinggi.
Naik bulu roma saya mendengar permintaan ini semua.
Bukan senang to realise all this dream.
Kena berani.....cari investors tak ada masalah.
Once u have satu successful module the rest will just follow mudah sahaja.
We shall see...
He said i want to target our revenue will go up to at least rm200 juta sebukan CW!
I almost fall off the chair semlm hearing his wishes.üòúü§¶
Berani ke ambil cabaran itu.
Anyway i have my signature home big sale demo today with Diana Danielle juga dia Ambassador.
With this event maka end la contract saya tahun ini as their kitchen Ambassador.
Alhamdulilah semua berjalan dgn baik dan sempurna.
Once the event end at 5pm i will need to rush home quickly and have my shower and head to KLIA for my 10.25pm flight to Tokyo on Japan Airline.
I really wanted to fly with MAS tapi the last business class ticket was taken by Dato Noraini and Dr Fadzil my last gang to Japan.
Since we are all suppose to meet together in Tokyo airport, collect our Shinkanzen 2 weeks train ticket before heading to Nagoya straight terpaksa la kami ambil JAL instead.
Nasib ada business class ticket depa lagi.
We both arrive pun different 1 jam sahaja.
So will wait for them.
Mean while my friend Wan Latifah dan suami left semlm.
Depa tidur di airport hotel saja then kita berenam semua akan bercuti bersama.
Gang2 gila travel ini semua i have known for 35 years.
Semua dah tua2 serabut but we always have so much fun laughing together in so many of our trip.

Inspired by Auguste Escoffier, Yannick All√©no doesn't hesitate to revisit the fundamentals and transform this heritage to create his own interpretation. He brought sauces back to the forefront, designed using processes like extraction, fermentation, and cryoconcentration, to capture the essence of flavors and allow ingredients to interact.

Posts.title: Pinot Noir Grape
Posts.content:
Back in 2012, we hosted a wine event with the world-renowned vineyard Chateau d‚ÄôYquem, for which our chefs and sommelier collaborated to create a dish that captured the aroma and flavour profile of what noble rot‚ÄîBotrytis Cinerea‚Äîdevelops in their legendary Sauternes. The complexity of the wine was matched by the complexity of the dish: the recipe has 55 stages in its preparation.

This year, we‚Äôre hosting another prestigious wine dinner, with the equally world-renowned vineyard, Domaine de la Roman√©e-Conti. In honour of their expression of the Pinot Noir grape, Heston and his development team, pastry chefs and sommeliers were busy creating a brand-new version of this epic dessert, this time inspired by the complex characteristics of Pinot Noir.

Pinot Noir Grape will be featured on our √† la carte menu from 18th July.

Posts.title: Three Knives Best Chef Award!
Posts.content:
Our warmest congratulations to @chef_julien on being awarded Three Knives once again by @thebestchefawards.

This honour celebrates chefs at the very top of their craft, and it feels even more meaningful to be recognised alongside chefs we‚Äôve long admired from around the world.

As we take this time to refresh our space and experience, this honour is a timely reminder of why we do what we do‚Äîand it fills us with hope and inspiration for the season ahead.
